Articles.Content: Time to drop mod baggage for RAM space

Time to drop mod baggage for RAM space

That's getting harder and harder everyday. The mod community is blossoming. Still gonna axe a few mods though
Time for part trimming and some Active Texture Management?

The size isn't so bad right now. We'll see

Figured I'd show some sketchup links. The materials and textures look like crap in Sketchfab for some reason, not like Unity/KSP. Those pics I posted above are straight from Unity Editor and KSP - both of which seem to have far better material and specular rendering.

That's getting harder and harder everyday. The mod community is blossoming. Still gonna axe a few mods though

I know right! Its really becoming one of those let me use as much of my 32 GB of RAM as possible games. Need 64 bit version support by Unity already.
My routine of mod trimming be like: I need this, and this, and this. In the end, I don't remove any mod at all.

Wow. This is incredible. I love this rocket. Can't wait for the final version.

Would you consider the Energia as your next project? It could use the Zenit's first stage as a booster (which you already modeled) and a modular main fuel tank to allow making all members of the family, from Energia-M to Vulkan. BobCat already did the baseline Energia, but it's a bit clunky and rather inflexible, pretty much only good for launching his Buran.
@Dragon - thanks! Energia is definitely on the list. Though the Vostok-1 is next on it

The next update of KSP will include an upgraded part connection system which will help with this issue. Though we don't know when it's coming. Until that only struts and Kerbal Joint Reinforcement can help.

I have a lot to do on the diffuse/spec, but I'm calling the normals done at least. This is the 1st stage fuel tank for the RD-171
So stubbles, any initial estimates on model size? KSO is 250mb and also the (3rd) most beautiful shuttle in existence.

Right now it's sitting at 52MB, including some custom engine sounds. There are still two more textures to complete (stage2 tank and RD-120 engine). But both of those are kind of already accounted for, since there are placeholder textures on them. So I wouldn't think it would grow much larger.

Isn't the maximum amt of ram the game can use 3.5 megs? The parts wouldn't load because they use more than that. Or am I completely wrong?

Isn't the maximum amt of ram the game can use 3.5 megs? The parts wouldn't load because they use more than that. Or am I completely wrong?

If you run out of RAM while loading, the game will crash.
DarthVader: the game can address somewhere around 3.4 *giga*bytes of RAM.
